But what about the whole original sequence? It alternates between 1 and -1, right? Then it doesn't converge because it keeps oscillating. That's a classic example where all proper subsequences converge (they either go to 1 or -1), but the entire sequence does not converge—it diverges.

So in that case, the statement is false. Because even though every proper subsequence converges, the whole sequence doesn't necessarily do so.
